reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Marriott several times and always find it to be first class. It's located near the walking street and numerous restaurants. If you want to explore Chongqing, it's a great base.
reviews.title: Well maintained, helpful staff, good food, great location.

reviews.text: my husband and I are both Platinum Members...we got an upgrade at check-in and the room is clean, however:
reviews.title: Worst JW Marriott, and even Worst Marriott in China
Our tour coach was blockaded by the hotel staff
reviews.text: 1. Smoking is allowed in the Executive Lounge, Business center is right in the middle of the smoking section!!! This is Outrageous.
2. Staffs are lack of experience - do not know much when ask for about local stuff - seems to be lack of training
reviews.title: Best Business Hotel in Chongqing (Award Winner)

reviews.text: 3. Even for Executive Platinum members, everything is extra: Intenet access, Local Phone calls, and even Tea in the room!!
reviews.title: Seeing the Sky through glass walls

reviews.text: The JW Marriott is centrally located in Chongqing and right around the corner from a pedestrian mall and shopping area with some good restaurants. Other than that . . .
reviews.title: Wished I'd stayed at the Sheraton towers

reviews.text: The entrance is cramped and slick in the rain, and it's challenging to get a room with a good view because so many buildings are soaring next to the hotel (which, to be fair, is the case with much of urban China).
reviews.title: Phenomenal

reviews.text: The rooms are small for a JW, the flagship brand of the Marriott group, frayed in several spots, and the bathrooms were about half the size of other top-class hotels in, say, Beijing or Shanghai.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for family stay

reviews.text: There also didn't seem to be a lot of staff at the ready to assist travelers with whatever needs might arise, even at the front door.
reviews.title: Not the best choice of international hotel in CQ
Don't waste money for "Club" Service
reviews.text: As my cruise ship left Chongqing in the evening, I pointed to the two glowing golden towers in the distance that, with a sky bridge joining them, resembled the Petronas Towers in KL.
Hotel staff are very friendly and try to be helpful
reviews.title: Great hotel for business - has some challenges

reviews.text: Hotel is older but well maintained
reviews.title: Good Hotel... Some Drawbacks

reviews.text: Executive lounge is comfortable - remember that the lounge is not a restaurant - so don't expect gourmet food
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.text: Staying at this hotel requires patience - i think it is the best that chongqing offers
reviews.title: First Class Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chinese restaurant in the hotel has excellent food but not very good service - i expect that this will improve over time
reviews.title: Terrible Terrible Terrible

reviews.text: My recent stay at the JW was quite nice. Although it wasn't without problems I thought they were handled well and resolved in my favor so I give them good marks for that. Upon check in the non-smoking room I had reserved was not available. Eventually I was upgraded to a much larger non-smoking room. Although this process took a long time and was not the smoothest, the staff did their best and were eventually able to resolve the matter. The hotel staff are all well trained and polite. They were very helpful with good restuarant recommendations and helped us find a nice hole in the wall place for hot pot. Thanks to them, it was easy to get a cab and find my way around the city. The rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. I used the gym one morning and found that facility ample and nice. The breakfast buffet is also a nice start to the day. My only complaint was that while the wait staff are eager to take your plates or bring new silverware, it's hard to get that second cup of coffee or tea.
reviews.title: Staff and Location Stand Out

reviews.text: I stay regularly at the JW in Chongqing. Its central location is great although the traffic at rush hour can be frustrating.
reviews.title: My choice in Chongqing

reviews.text: The staff and service are consistent and the reason I return is that I know I will get a comfortable and easy few nights.
reviews.title: Great location, nice rooms, helpful staff.

reviews.text: We always stay here when in town on business. We have tried other hotels on our own dime. So, if I'm not paying, the Marriott is great.
reviews.title: Best in Chongqing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our own we have enjoyed the Hong Ya Hotel. Great river views, located at the best place in town to buy souvenirs.
reviews.title: great location
